everyone.translation[0].definitions[0].e: If everyone is ready, I’ll begin.
Send my best wishes to everyone in the family.
Of course everyone else thought it was hilarious!
everyone.translation[0].note_box[0].item: Use a singular verb after everyone
everyone.translation[0].note_box[1].head: USAGE: Everyone, every one
everyone.translation[0].note_box[1].item: You use everyone when you mean 'all of the people in a group' You write it as one word
You use every one when you mean 'every person or thing in a group, considered as separate people or things' You write it as two words
There are no chocolates left − someone has eaten every one
You say every one of a group of people or things  Don't write
I wish to thank every one of you
